ygData.subject: RE: Re: What to buy?
ygData.msgSnippet: Keep your cured silk gi !!!!!! Be a monk !!!!!!! I kept it til lvl 38, when I got my Robe.   ;o) Well, look is very important for me, so that was my choice,
ygData.messageBody:
Keep your cured silk gi !!!!!! Be a monk !!!!!!! I kept it til lvl 38, when
I got my Robe. ;o)
Well, look is very important for me, so that was my choice, and I was ok in
fights. You do what you want, of course. Hehe...

Tsin Suchiko
40th rank, Tunare.


-----Original Message-----
From: Andy Sands [mailto:andy.sands@...]
Sent: Friday, February 04, 2000 10:31 AM
To: EQ-Monks@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [EQ-Monks] Re: What to buy?


From: Andy Sands <andy.sands@...>

Hehe Clarity

Starting a fight on my behalf?

>I'm sorry, but what are you talking about? Herrick is a level 12 monk
talking
>about saving up scarab carapaces for 1.7gp each! Do you think this guy
has
>30pp to go buy a bracer of erolisi? or 100pp to get a silver-plated
bracer?
>Please tell me what armor better than cured even a level 18 can go get?

13th now :)
I have seen people selling Lockjaw Vests around Freeport, and was thinking
of saving for one. They are about 30pp.. and I've about 11 saved so far..

Admittedly it's a lot at my level, but if I saved up 50pp for some Wu's
then by the time I hit 18, I should have bought a bit more stuff (although
I am currently spending most of my income on training up my brewing skill)

Finally got my orange sash too.


--
Herrick of Quellious [Champions of Justice]
13th Circle
Bristlebane

E-mail: andy@...
